forumNotes.author: wimb
forumNotes.content:
> Yeah I might give that a go but PLOP doesn't currently work with my motherboard so booting the LiveXP from my USB stick is rather slow.
In most cases you don't need to boot from USB-stick and can do Install XP from USB-stick prepared with **Make_USB.exe**   
You can use **BOOT_IMG.exe** to install LiveXP BootSDI.img as boot option on Harddisk and then boot in 30 sec in LiveXP PE environment running in RAMDISK.  
The nice thing is once PE is running in RAMDISK, you are allowed to format and prepare your harddisk for install of XP using **USB_XP_Setup.exe**
